title: Epitaph for Agathe
support: A marble plaque, intact on the left margin and above (although with an uneven edge), broken on the right and below; the text however appears to be complete and to follow the shape of the stone on the right margin.

layout.p: The text appears to observes the shape of the stone, with a fixed left margin and the lines fitting to the line of breakage on the right, and a staurogram centrally filling the space below. The letters retain traces of red paint throughout.

handNote.lettering: Slightly irregular but neatly carved plain letters without serifs. Alpha has straight bar; Epsilon is rectilinear, with mostly equal length bars; Theta is large and voice, with a full width horizontal bar; Kappa generally has short arms; Lamda has a slight extension at the top; Mu (in ligature) has vertical virst and last, with diagonals extending only half-way down;' rho has small head, closed; sigma is lunate but rectilinear; omega is lunate. Interpuncts are used around numerals.

provenanceFound._: From the , seemingly from the explorations of c.1874 by Cavallari.

graphics.desc: Photo Museo Arch. Reg. P. Orsi (2012), Aut. Assessorato Beni Culturali Regione Siciliana n.10681 del 06/05/2014

museum.name: Museo Archeologico Regionale Paolo Orsi
museum.description: An outstanding collection of archaeological material. The collection ranges from Siracusa and the surrounding territory (Megara Hyblaia, Akrai, Kasmenai etc) to encompass all of eastern Sicily, reaching as far as Gela and Agrigento. The ground floor covers prehistory through to the end of the Classical period. Upstairs includes Hellenistic and Roman Syracuse and a display of material from the catacombs. A gallery displaying material from Hellenistic eastern Sicily is in preparation.
